articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas official Sami Abu Zuhri said on Wednesday that U.S. President Donald Trump's remarks about taking over the Gaza Strip are "ridiculous" and "absurd" and could destabilise the Middle East.
articles.title: Hamas official says Trump's remarks about taking over Gaza could ignite the region

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday there was nothing wrong in Donald Trump's idea of displacing Palestinians from Gaza after the U.S. president's proposal drew international criticism.
articles.title: Netanyahu praises Trump plan to move Palestinians out of Gaza

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Alison Withers
articles.description: Last month was the world's warmest January on record, continuing a streak of extreme global temperatures despite a shift towards the cooling La Nina weather pattern, European Union scientists said on Thursday.
articles.title: Year begins with warmest January despite shift towards cooling La Nina

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of protesters set fire to the home of Bangladesh's founding leader, as his daughter, ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina delivered a fiery social media speech calling on her supporters to stand against the interim government.
articles.title: Bangladesh protesters torch ousted PM Hasina's father's home

articles.author: Ismail Shakil
articles.description: One person died and 15 were arrested trying to enter Canada from the United States in three incidents in recent weeks, Canadian police said on Wednesday, highlighting efforts to secure the border as U.S. President Donald Trump demands a crackdown.
articles.title: One dead, 15 arrested trying to enter Canada from US in three weeks, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping met Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in Beijing on Thursday, the official Xinhua news agency reported, as the two countries eye closer ties amid growing global uncertainties.
articles.title: China's Xi meets Thai prime minister with trade, online scams in focus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine Senate can only act on the impeachment complaint against Vice-President Sara Duterte on June 2 when Congress resumes after the midterm elections, Senate President Francis Escudero told a briefing on Thursday.
articles.title: Philippines Senate head says cannot hear impeachment complaint against vice-president until June

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Thousands gathered across New Zealand on Thursday to celebrate the signing of the country’s founding document and some called for an end to government policies that critics say erode the rights promised to the Indigenous Maori population.
articles.title: New Zealanders celebrate national day amid debate over founding treaty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish police said on Wednesday that "erroneous narratives" were being spread on social media regarding the mass shooting on Tuesday at an adult education centre, the Nordic country's deadliest gun attack.
articles.title: Swedish police say 'erroneous narratives' are spreading online after mass school shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Panama Canal Authority said in a statement late on Wednesday that it had not made any changes to charges or rights to cross the canal, after the U.S. State Department said that U.S. government vessels could transit the crossing without being subject to such fees.
articles.title: Panama Canal authority denies changes to charge fees after US claim
